content.text: How TO - Dropdown Navbar
Learn how to create a dropdown navigation bar.
content.html: Learn how to create a dropdown navigation bar.

content.text: Dropdown Menu in Navbar
Try it Yourself »
Create A Dropdown Navbar
Create a dropdown menu that appears when the user moves the mouse over an element inside a navigation bar.
content.html: Create a dropdown menu that appears when the user moves the mouse over an element inside a navigation bar.

content.text: Step 1) Add HTML:

content.code:
Home   News  
       
      Link 1       Link 2       Link 3
content.code_html:
<div class="navbar">
  <a href="#home">Home</a>
  <a href="#news">News</a>
  <div class="dropdown">
    <button class="dropbtn">Dropdown
      <i class="fa fa-caret-down"></i>
    </button>
    <div class="dropdown-content">
      <a href="#">Link 1</a>
      <a href="#">Link 2</a>
      <a href="#">Link 3</a>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

content.text: Example Explained
Use any element to open the dropdown menu, e.g. a
content.html: Use any element to open the dropdown menu, e.g. a <button>, <a> or <p> element.

content.text: Use a container element (like <div>) to create the dropdown menu and add the dropdown links inside it.
content.html: Use a container element (like <div>) to create the dropdown menu and add the dropdown links inside it.

content.text: Wrap a <div> element around the button and the <div> to position the dropdown menu correctly with CSS.
content.html: Wrap a <div> element around the button and the <div> to position the dropdown menu correctly with CSS.

content.text: Step 2) Add CSS:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */
/* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */

/* Add a 
  red background color to navbar links on hover */

/* Add a grey background color to dropdown links 
  on hover */

/* 
  Show the dropdown menu on hover */

syntax_highlighting.text: /* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */
/* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */

/* Add a 
  red background color to navbar links on hover */

/* Add a grey background color to dropdown links 
  on hover */

/* 
  Show the dropdown menu on hover */

content.code_html:
/* Navbar container */
.navbar {
  overflow: hidden;
  background-color: #333;
  font-family: Arial;
}

/* Links inside the navbar */
.navbar a {
  float: left;
  font-size: 16px;
  color: white;
  text-align: center;
  padding: 14px 16px;
  text-decoration: none;
}

/* The dropdown container */
.dropdown {
  float: left;
  overflow: hidden;
}

/* Dropdown button */
.dropdown .dropbtn {
  font-size: 16px;
  border: none;
  outline: none;
  color: white;
  padding: 14px 16px;
  background-color: inherit;
  font-family: inherit; /* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */
  margin: 0; /* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */
}

/* Add a red background color to navbar links on hover */
.navbar a:hover, .dropdown:hover .dropbtn {
  background-color: red;
}

/* Dropdown content (hidden by default) */
.dropdown-content {
  display: none;
  position: absolute;
  background-color: #f9f9f9;
  min-width: 160px;
  box-shadow: 0px 8px 16px 0px rgba(0,0,0,0.2);
  z-index: 1;
}

/* Links inside the dropdown */
.dropdown-content a {
  float: none;
  color: black;
  padding: 12px 16px;
  text-decoration: none;
  display: block;
  text-align: left;
}

/* Add a grey background color to dropdown links on hover */
.dropdown-content a:hover {
  background-color: #ddd;
}

/* Show the dropdown menu on hover */
.dropdown:hover .dropdown-content {
  display: block;
}

/* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */

/* Add a 
  red background color to navbar links on hover */

content.text: Example Explained
We have styled the navigation bar and the navbar links with a background-color, padding, etc.
content.html: We have styled the navigation bar and the navbar links with a background-color, padding, etc.

content.text: We have styled the dropdown button with a background-color, padding, etc.
content.html: We have styled the dropdown button with a background-color, padding, etc.

content.text: The .dropdown class is the container for .dropdown-content . Since this is a <div> element, and not an <a> element, we have to float it to make sure that it stays next to the links.
content.html: The .dropdown class is the container for .dropdown-content. Since this is a <div> element, and not an <a> element, we have to float it to make sure that it stays next to the links.

content.text: The .dropdown-content class holds the actual dropdown menu. It is hidden by default, and will be displayed on hover (see below). Note the min-width is set to 160px. Feel free to change this.
content.html: The .dropdown-content class holds the actual dropdown menu. It is hidden by default, and will be displayed on hover (see below). Note the min-width is set to 160px. Feel free to change this.

content.text: Instead of using a border, we have used the box-shadow property to make the dropdown menu look like a "card". We also use z-index to place the dropdown in front of other elements.
content.html: Instead of using a border, we have used the box-shadow property to make the dropdown menu look like a "card". We also use z-index to place the dropdown in front of other elements.

content.text: The :hover selector is used to show the dropdown menu when the user moves the mouse over the dropdown button.
content.html: The :hover selector is used to show the dropdown menu when the user moves the mouse over the dropdown button.
